titles.ar: باب الْوَصِيِّ يُدْرِكُ أَيْتَامُهُ فَيَمْتَنِعُونَ مِنْ أَخْذِ مَالِهِمْ وَ مَنْ يُدْرِكُ وَ لَا يُؤْنَسُ مِنْهُ الرُّشْدُ وَ حَدِّ الْبُلُوغِ
titles.en: Chapter 39 – The executor, orphans (under his care) become adults, but they shy away from taking their wealth, and the one who is an adult does not have the understanding of the guidance, and the limit of the adulthood

titles.ar: باب الْوَصِيِّ يُدْرِكُ أَيْتَامُهُ فَيَمْتَنِعُونَ مِنْ أَخْذِ مَالِهِمْ وَ مَنْ يُدْرِكُ وَ لَا يُؤْنَسُ مِنْهُ الرُّشْدُ وَ حَدِّ الْبُلُوغِ
titles.en: Chapter 39 – The executor, orphans (under his care) become adults, but they shy away from taking their wealth, and the one who is an adult does not have the understanding of the guidance, and the limit of the adulthood

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ الرِّضَا عَنْ وَصِيِّ أَيْتَامٍ تُدْرِكُ أَيْتَامُهُ فَيَعْرِضُ عَلَيْهِمْ أَنْ يَأْخُذُوا الَّذِي لَهُمْ فَيَأْبَوْنَ عَلَيْهِ كَيْفَ يَصْنَعُ قَالَ ( عليه السلام ) يَرُدُّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ وَ يُكْرِهُهُمْ عَلَى ذَلِكَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Sa’ad Bin Ismail, from his father who said, 
‘I asked Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> about an executor of orphans, whose orphans become away (adults), but they turn away from taking that which is for them, so they refuse against him. So how should he deal with it?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘He should return upon them (the legacy) and compel them upon that’.

verses.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى [عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى] عَنْ مَنْصُورٍ عَنْ هِشَامٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ انْقِطَاعُ يُتْمِ الْيَتِيمِ بِالِاحْتِلَامِ وَ هُوَ أَشُدُّهُ وَ إِنِ احْتَلَمَ وَ لَمْ يُؤْنَسْ مِنْهُ رُشْدٌ وَ كَانَ سَفِيهاً أَوْ ضَعِيفاً فَلْيُمْسِكْ عَنْهُ وَلِيُّهُ مَالَهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Mansour, from Hisham, 
Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> has said: ‘The orphan-hood of the orphan is cut-off with the bed-wetting, and he is at its peak. And if he bed-wets and does not have the correct understanding from it, and was foolish, or weak (of understanding), so let his guardian withhold his wealth from him’.

verses.text:
حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ مُثَنَّى بْنِ رَاشِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ يَتِيمٍ قَدْ قَرَأَ الْقُرْآنَ وَ لَيْسَ بِعَقْلِهِ بَأْسٌ وَ لَهُ مَالٌ عَلَى يَدَيْ رَجُلٍ فَأَرَادَ الرَّجُلُ الَّذِي عِنْدَهُ الْمَالُ أَنْ يَعْمَلَ بِمَالِ الْيَتِيمِ مُضَارَبَةً فَأَذِنَ لَهُ الْغُلَامُ فِي ذَلِكَ فَقَالَ لَا يَصْلُحُ أَنْ يَعْمَلَ بِهِ حَتَّى يَحْتَلِمَ وَ يَدْفَعَ إِلَيْهِ مَالَهُ قَالَ وَ إِنِ احْتَلَمَ وَ لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ عَقْلٌ لَمْ يُدْفَعْ إِلَيْهِ شَيْ‏ءٌ أَبَداً .
حُمَيْدٌ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ سِرْحَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مِثْلَ ذَلِكَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Humeyd Bin Ziyad, from Al Hassan Bin Muhammad Bin Sama’at, from one of his companions, from Masny Bin Rashid, from Abu Baseer, 
(The narrator says): ‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about an orphan who has read the Quran, and there is nothing wrong with his intellect. And for him is wealth in the hands of a man. So the man wanted to do some business with the wealth of the orphan which was with him on a profit-sharing basis. So the boy permitted him with regards to that’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It is not correct that he works with it until he (the orphan) bed-wets and hands over his wealth to him. And if he were to bed-wet and there does not happen to be intellect for him, nothing would be handed over to him (the businessman), ever’. 
Humeyd, from Al Hassan, from Ja’far Bin Sama’at, from Dawood Bin Sirhan, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, similar to that’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِبَاطٍ وَ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ هَاشِمٍ وَ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ عِيصِ بْنِ الْقَاسِمِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الْيَتِيمَةِ مَتَى يُدْفَعُ إِلَيْهَا مَالُهَا قَالَ إِذَا عَلِمْتَ أَنَّهَا لَا تُفْسِدُ وَ لَا تُضَيِّعُ فَسَأَلْتُهُ إِنْ كَانَتْ قَدْ تَزَوَّجَتْ فَقَالَ إِذَا تَزَوَّجَتْ فَقَدِ انْقَطَعَ مِلْكُ الْوَصِيِّ عَنْهَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Al Hassan Bin Muhammad Bin Sama’at, from Ali Bin Rabaat and Al Husayn Bin Hashim and Safwan Bin Yahya, from Ays Bin Al Qasim, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about the orphan girl, when should her wealth be handed over to her?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘When it is known that she would neither spoil it nor waste it’.
So I asked him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘If she got married?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘If she were to get married, the possession (authority) of the executor is cut-off from her’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ بَكْرٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا يُدْخَلُ بِالْجَارِيَةِ حَتَّى تَأْتِيَ لَهَا تِسْعُ سِنِينَ أَوْ عَشْرُ سِنِينَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Al Hassan, from Safwan, from Musa Bin Bakr, from Zurara, 
Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> has said: ‘There should be no copulation with a (slave) girl until she comes to be of nine or ten years of age’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ آدَمَ بَيَّاعِ اللُّؤْلُؤِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِذَا بَلَغَ الْغُلَامُ ثَلَاثَ عَشْرَةَ سَنَةً كُتِبَتْ لَهُ الْحَسَنَةُ وَ كُتِبَتْ عَلَيْهِ السَّيِّئَةُ وَ عُوقِبَ وَ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ الْجَارِيَةُ تِسْعَ سِنِينَ فَكَذَلِكَ وَ ذَلِكَ أَنَّهَا تَحِيضُ لِتِسْعِ سِنِينَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Al Hassan, from Ja’far Bin Sama’at, from Adam Baya Al Lulu, from Abdullah Bin Sinan, 
Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> has said: ‘When the boy reaches thirteen years, the good deeds are Written for him, and the evil deeds are Written against him, and Punished. And when the girl reaches nine years, so it is like that, and that is because she menstruates at nine years’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِذَا بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ ثَلَاثَ عَشْرَةَ سَنَةً وَ دَخَلَ فِي الْأَرْبَعَ عَشْرَةَ وَجَبَ عَلَيْهِ مَا وَجَبَ عَلَى الْمُحْتَلِمِينَ احْتَلَمَ أَوْ لَمْ يَحْتَلِمْ كُتِبَتْ عَلَيْهِ السَّيِّئَاتُ وَ كُتِبَتْ لَهُ الْحَسَنَاتُ وَ جَازَ لَهُ كُلُّ شَيْ‏ءٍ إِلَّا أَنْ يَكُونَ ضَعِيفاً أَوْ سَفِيهاً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Al Washa, from Abdullah Bin Sinan, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>: ‘When a boy is strong at thirteen years, and enters into the fourteenth, It is Obligated upon him what is Obligatory upon the bed-wetting ones, whether he has bed-wetted or not. The evil deeds are written against him, and the good deeds are Written for him, and everything is allowed for him unless he happens to be weak (of understanding) or foolish’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِي مُحَمَّدٍ الْمَدَائِنِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ حَبِيبٍ بَيَّاعِ الْهَرَوِيِّ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِي عِيسَى بْنُ زَيْدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ صَلَوَاتُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ يَثَّغِرُ الصَّبِيُّ لِسَبْعٍ وَ يُؤْمَرُ بِالصَّلَاةِ لِتِسْعٍ وَ يُفَرَّقُ بَيْنَهُمْ فِي الْمَضَاجِعِ لِعَشْرٍ وَ يَحْتَلِمُ لِأَرْبَعَ عَشْرَةَ وَ يَنْتَهِي طُولُهُ لِإِحْدَى وَ عِشْرِينَ سَنَةً وَ يَنْتَهِي عَقْلُهُ لِثَمَانٍ وَ عِشْرِينَ إِلَّا التَّجَارِبَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Abu Muhammad Al Madainy, from Ali Bin Habeeb Bayaa Al Harwy, from Isa Bin Zayd, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>: ‘Amir Al Momineen<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The child (stops) teething at seven, and he is ordered with the Prayer at ten, and he should be separated with regards to his bed at ten, and he bed-wets at fourteen, and his tallness ends at twenty one, and his intellect completes at twenty eight, except for the experiences’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَمَّنْ رَوَاهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ أَوْصَى إِلَى رَجُلٍ وَ لَهُ ابْنٌ صَغِيرٌ فَأَدْرَكَ الْغُلَامُ وَ ذَهَبَ إِلَى الْوَصِيِّ فَقَالَ لَهُ رُدَّ عَلَيَّ مَالِي لِأَتَزَوَّجَ فَأَبَى عَلَيْهِ فَذَهَبَ حَتَّى زَنَى قَالَ يُلْزَمُ ثُلُثَيْ إِثْمِ زِنَى هَذَا الرَّجُلِ ذَلِكَ الْوَصِيُّ لِأَنَّهُ مَنَعَهُ الْمَالَ وَ لَمْ يُعْطِهِ فَكَانَ يَتَزَوَّجُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Hassan, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from the one who reported it, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> regarding a man who died and bequeathed to a man (to be an executor), and for him was a young son. So the boy became an adult, and went to the executor, so he said to him, ‘Return to me my wealth so that I can get married. But he refused him. So he went and committed adultery’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Two-thirds of the sin of the adultery of this man is upon the executor because he prevented the wealth from him, and did not give it, so he could have got married’.

verses.text: تَمَّ كِتَابُ الْوَصَايَا وَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ وَ صَلَوَاتُهُ عَلَى خَيْرِ خَلْقِهِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ آلِهِ الطَّاهِرِينَ وَ يَتْلُوهُ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ تَعَالَى كِتَابُ الْمَوَارِيثِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: The Book of the Bequests is complete; and the Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup> the Lord<sup>azwj</sup> of the Worlds, and His<sup>azwj</sup> Blessing be upon the best of His<sup>azwj</sup> creatures, and his<sup>saww</sup> Purified Progeny<sup>asws</sup>, and it will be followed, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Willing, by the Book of the Inheritance.
